page.title: 06RECREATION IN EVERSHOLT
page.content:
There are two public houses in the village whereas there were originally seven. Other activities include a branch of the Royal British Legion, Bowls Club, Women's Institute and a cricket club using the well maintained ground near to the church. This ground stands on the site of the former manor. Adjacent is Eversholt Swimming Pool, now heated, an unusual facility for a small village. It is remembered by many who used it in its unheated days with awe!
There is a Mother and Toddler Club and the Triple Club, a meeting place for the elderly from Eversholt, Tingrith and Milton Bryan.
